data.prayer: Father, you desire to blot out the sins of the people of Munshiganj, Dhaka, Bangladesh. You said, if they turn to you, you will dissolve their sins like mist.
data.verse: I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, your transgressions, and, as a cloud, your sins. Return to me, for I have redeemed you.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Munshiganj, Dhaka, Bangladesh

data.prayer: Father, let the threatened of Munshiganj, Dhaka, Bangladesh know that it is better to trust in you than to trust in humans.
data.verse: It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in humans.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 798 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Father, please reward those who diligently seek you with a heart of faith in the county of Munshiganj.
data.verse: Without faith it is impossible to be well pleasing to him, for he who comes to God must believe that he exists, and that he is a rewarder of those who seek him.

data.prayer: Lord, raise up apostolic workers to plant churches in every town in the county of Munshiganj.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.

data.prayer: Jesus, I pray that all the Kalu people will remember and turn to you, Lord God. May all the Kalu people worship before you. For the kingdom of the Kalu people is yours.
Jesus, help the local leaders in Munshiganj, Dhaka, Bangladesh to be faithful with what they have been given, whether a little or a lot.
data.verse: Everyone to whom much was given, of him much will be required, and from him to whom they entrusted much, they will demand the more.

data.prayer: Father, put your Bible in the hands of the 1,439,552, who are far from you and live in this place.
data.verse: How can a young person stay on the path of purity? By living according to your Word. I seek you with all my heart; do not let me stray from your commands.

data.prayer: Please, teach the 1,811 believers in Munshiganj, Dhaka, Bangladesh how to pray to you and how to listen for your voice. That they might follow you into the good works you have prepared for them.
data.verse: My sheep listen to my voice; I know them, and they follow me.

location.name: Munshiganj
location.people_groups_list: Jogi (Muslim traditions), Jharudar, Jat (Muslim traditions), Jaraj (Muslim traditions), Jamadar
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Jogi (Muslim traditions) (5,000), Jharudar (300), Jat (Muslim traditions) (4,100), Jaraj (Muslim traditions) (19,000), Jamadar (300)
